catalog_metadata.data_quality_note: This catalog contains ONLY verified data from official sources. Any unavailable data is explicitly marked as 'not available' with source URLs provided for manual verification. v1.1 adds customer class designations (residential, commercial, industrial). v1.2 adds size thresholds for customer class eligibility.

programs.description: Emergency demand response program that pays qualified loads and generators to make themselves available for deployment during grid emergencies to prevent system-wide load shedding.

service_territories: ERCOT footprint (approximately 90% of Texas electric load)

eligibility.notes: Must be a Qualified Scheduling Entity (QSE) or work through one. QSE must be capable of receiving XML messaging and Verbal Dispatch Instructions (VDI). Customer classes: Wholesale market program requiring QSE status - commercial/industrial only

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Wholesale market program requiring QSE status - commercial/industrial only. No specific size thresholds.

notification_methods: Verbal Dispatch Instructions (VDI) to QSE Hotline

seasonal_rates.notes: 2023 range: $0.29/MWh to $53/MWh in summer high-stress hours. Total 2023 program cost approximately $49 million.

capacity_rate.notes: Participants are paid based on clearing price from competitive auction, contract capacity, and participation hours. 2024 total program costs approximately $573 million (includes system administrative fees).

performance_rate.notes: Payment is primarily capacity-based through auction clearing prices

call_windows.notes: ERS can be called any time during grid emergency conditions

event_parameters.notes: Four service types: Weather-Sensitive ERS-10, Non-Weather-Sensitive ERS-10, Weather-Sensitive ERS-30, Non-Weather-Sensitive ERS-30

event_triggers.primary_trigger: PRC falls below 3,000 MW and is not expected to recover within 30 minutes following deployment of non-spinning reserves
secondary_triggers: Energy Emergency Alert (EEA) Level 1, 2, or 3 conditions
event_triggers.other_conditions: Deployed to prevent or alleviate actual or anticipated Energy Emergency Alert events

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: Procurement occurs four times per year for each season
nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Competitive auction with clearing price mechanism. QSEs submit offers specifying capacity and price. ERCOT evaluates based on cost-effectiveness, geographic location, and grid congestion impact.

historical_events.notes: Winter Storm Uri - all ERS Resources with deployment obligation were deployed during Energy Emergency Alert
Energy Emergency Alert Level 2 (EEA 2) issued around 7:30 PM local time, lifted after approximately 1 hour. First ERS deployment since February 2021.

programs.historical_events_notes: Between February 2021 and September 2023, no ERS deployments occurred. Full historical event data available at ERCOT website in 'ERS Event History' document dated September 2024.

data_sources.source_name: 2024 State of the Market Report for ERCOT

integration_metadata.notes: Requires QSE status for participation. XML messaging integration required. Event triggers based on grid conditions (PRC < 3000 MW) make this suitable for co-optimization with energy arbitrage.

programs.description: Emergency demand response program that pays $2/kWh for load reduction during grid emergency events, typically May-October between 4-9 PM.

eligibility.minimum_capacity_kw: varies by utility and customer type
eligibility.notes: Can participate directly or through aggregator/DRP Customer classes: Both residential (Power Saver Rewards at $1/kWh) and non-residential ($2/kWh). Expanded to residential in 2022.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Residential: No minimum. Non-residential: Must be able to reduce load by minimum of 1 kW. Residential compensated at $1/kWh, non-residential at $2/kWh.

notification.notes: Day-Ahead events: notification by 5 PM day before (CAISO declares by 3 PM). Day-Of events: notification shortly after CAISO EEA declaration.

performance_rate.notes: Also expressed as $2,000/MWh. Zero penalties if participants cannot participate.

seasons.notes: Program runs May through October. Participants will not be asked to participate for more than 60 hours per year.

call_windows.notes: Events occur between 4-9 PM on any day of the week

event_parameters.max_consecutive_events: not specified - can be called on consecutive days

event_triggers.primary_trigger: Day-Ahead: EEA Watch declaration by CAISO by 3 PM day before. Day-Of: EEA Watch, EEA-1, EEA-2, or EEA-3 declaration.
secondary_triggers: Residential: Flex Alert issued by CAISO
High locational marginal prices in CAISO markets
event_triggers.price_threshold: Day-ahead DLAP prices exceeding $200/MWh for DSGS Option 3
event_triggers.other_conditions: IOUs exercise discretion in calling events based on anticipated grid conditions

program_evolution.change_description: Program launched with ~200 MW non-residential participation. Called 4 times in early summer 2021.
Multiple dispatches during severe heat wave August 31 - September 9, 2022
10 event days dispatched. July 24 dispatched all groups except A.4 and A.6. A.5 only group dispatched after September.

historical_events.notes: Called 4 times in early summer 2021 with nearly 200 MW of enrolled non-residential participation
Multiple dispatches during severe heat wave period August 31 - September 9, 2022. Record-setting temperatures over 10-day period.
All groups dispatched except A.4 and A.6

programs.historical_events_notes: 10 event days total in 2024. Specific dates for all events not available in public sources. More detailed event data may be available at CPUC ELRP Data and Information page.

data_sources.source_name: CAISO 2024 Summer Loads and Resources Assessment

integration_metadata.notes: High performance payment of $2/kWh makes this very attractive for battery optimization. Event triggers are based on CAISO EEA declarations which can be monitored via API. Limited to 60 hours/year.

programs.description: Utility demand response program for battery storage and smart thermostats that pays annual performance incentives based on average discharged power during summer peak events.

eligibility.notes: Residential and commercial customers with eligible battery storage or smart thermostats Customer classes: Residential battery storage and smart thermostat program. Systems < 50kW.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Systems < 50kW qualify as residential. Systems >= 50kW should enroll through Commercial ConnectedSolutions Program.

notification.notes: Notification given day before peak energy event. Events typically called on hot days.

capacity_rate.notes: Average $275/kW annual incentive for Eversource and National Grid MA customers. Payment based on average discharged AC power in kW during events, paid at end of year.

performance_rate.notes: Payment is performance-based but calculated as annual $/kW based on actual discharge during events

seasons.notes: Events occur on non-holiday weekdays between June 1 and September 30

call_windows.notes: All events occur between 3:00 PM and 8:00 PM on non-holiday weekdays

event_parameters.notes: Typically 10-20 events per summer, each lasting 2-3 hours. About 15 peak events typical.

event_triggers.trigger_description: High temperature forecast and grid stress conditions
event_triggers.primary_trigger: Hot day temperature forecasts indicating high electricity demand
event_triggers.other_conditions: Peak demand periods on especially hot days

programs.historical_events_notes: Historical event data not available in public sources. Utilities track events internally but specific dates/times not published.

data_sources.source_name: Clean Energy Group ConnectedSolutions Resource Page

integration_metadata.notes: Attractive for behind-the-meter batteries. $275/kW annual payment. Events called on hot days 3-8 PM. Automated dispatch through approved vendors. Limited public API availability.

programs.description: Rhode Island utility demand response program for battery storage with tiered payment rates based on enrollment date.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Residential battery storage program. No specific size threshold documented.

eligibility.notes: Customer classes: Residential battery storage program

capacity_rate.notes: Enrolled before June 1, 2024: $400/kW guaranteed for 5 years. Enrolled after June 1, 2024: $225/kW. Program approved for 2024-2026.

event_triggers.trigger_description: High temperature forecast and grid stress
event_triggers.primary_trigger: Peak demand periods on hot days

program_evolution.change_description: Rate reduction from $400/kW to $225/kW for new enrollments after June 1, 2024. Existing participants grandfathered at $400/kW for 5 years. Program approved for 2024-2026.

programs.historical_events_notes: Historical event data not available in public sources

integration_metadata.notes: Higher payment rate ($225-400/kW) than MA. Early enrollees get $400/kW guaranteed 5 years.

programs.description: New Hampshire battery storage demand response program with upfront incentive payment.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Residential battery storage program. No specific size threshold documented.

eligibility.notes: Customer classes: Residential battery storage program

capacity_rate.notes: Upfront payment of $230 per eligible kWh, up to $3,000 maximum. Paid once battery receives permission to operate and is accepted into program. Based on 80% of kWh discharge capacity.

event_triggers.trigger_description: High temperature forecast and grid stress
event_triggers.primary_trigger: Peak demand periods on hot days

programs.historical_events_notes: Historical event data not available in public sources

data_sources.source_name: Eversource NH Battery Storage Demand Response

integration_metadata.notes: Unique upfront payment structure. $230/kWh up to $3,000. Based on 80% of battery capacity.

programs.description: California state-funded battery demand response program providing monthly capacity payments during May-October, with VPP aggregator bonus.

eligibility.notes: Must participate through VPP aggregator Customer classes: Residential battery storage program (Powerwall and similar home batteries)

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Residential battery storage program (Powerwall and similar home batteries). No specific size threshold documented.

capacity_rate.notes: Rates for 2024-2025. Annual capacity prices range $7,200-$19,200 depending on month and day-type selection. Participants can earn approximately $60-80 per kW per program year or up to $350/year per Powerwall.

performance_rate.notes: Some participants earn $2/kWh for energy shared with grid

bonus_payments.conditions: VPP aggregators receive additional 30% bonus for program years 2023-2026

call_windows.notes: Event windows vary by option selected

secondary_triggers: Forecasted or anticipated grid stress conditions
event_triggers.other_conditions: VPP, VGI, and non-residential aggregations may be notified day-ahead or day-of

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Fixed monthly capacity payments, must participate through approved VPP aggregator

program_evolution.change_description: Program expanded to 500 MW of capacity. Fourth edition guidelines published.
Updated guidelines and monthly rate schedule for 2024-2025 program years

program_history.total_annual_budget: part of California Strategic Reliability Reserve

programs.historical_events_notes: Historical event data not available in public sources. Events called based on price triggers and grid conditions.

integration_metadata.notes: Strong monthly capacity payments ($7-$15/kW-month). 30% VPP aggregator bonus. Option 3 has clear price trigger ($200/MWh). Must work through approved aggregator.

programs.description: State renewable energy certificate program requiring retail electric suppliers to procure Clean Peak Energy Certificates (CPECs) from qualified clean energy resources that supply electricity or reduce demand during seasonal peak periods.

eligibility.notes: Customer classes: Both residential (< 50kW) and commercial/industrial (>= 50kW) eligible

performance_rate.notes: Revenue from selling Clean Peak Energy Certificates (CPECs) in competitive market. Not a fixed payment rate.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Suppliers face compliance penalties if they fail to procure required CPECs

seasons.notes: Seasonal peak demand periods established by DOER

call_windows.notes: Specific seasonal peak demand periods established by MA DOER

event_parameters.notes: Scheduled dispatch windows based on seasonal peak periods, not event-based

event_triggers.primary_trigger: Pre-defined seasonal peak demand periods set by MA DOER
event_triggers.other_conditions: Operates on scheduled windows, not triggered by emergencies

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Competitive RFP process for CPEC procurement. Staggered procurement schedule established as of October 2024.

program_evolution.change_description: October 11, 2024: Emergency rulemaking filed requiring staggered procurement schedule for CPEC RFPs by November 12, 2024. March 25, 2024: Stakeholder feedback solicited for 2024 CPS Review.

program_history.notes: State estimates $710 million net ratepayer savings and 560,000 metric tons CO2 reduction over 10 years

programs.historical_events_notes: Not event-based. Uses scheduled seasonal peak periods defined by MA DOER.

data_sources.source_name: MA DOER Clean Peak Energy Standard

integration_metadata.notes: REC-based program with market pricing. Scheduled dispatch windows (not emergency events). Certificates traded via NEPOOL GIS. Requires understanding of seasonal peak periods and CPEC market prices for optimization.

programs.program_name: ISO-NE Forward Capacity Market Demand Response
programs.description: ISO New England wholesale capacity market allowing demand response resources to compete with traditional generation for capacity payments 3 years forward.

eligibility.notes: Can participate directly or through aggregator. Must qualify through FCA qualification process. Customer classes: Wholesale capacity market - commercial/industrial only

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Wholesale capacity market - commercial/industrial only. Minimum capacity varies by resource type.

capacity_rate.notes: FCA 18 (Feb 2024) for delivery period June 2027-May 2028. More than 8% (2,614 MW) of obligations from DR and aggregated DER.

performance_rate.notes: DRRs can participate in energy and reserve markets, compensated at locational marginal prices

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Performance penalties for failure to deliver during shortage conditions

seasons.notes: Delivery period runs June 1 through May 31 (3 years after auction)

call_windows.notes: Can be dispatched any time based on system needs

event_triggers.primary_trigger: Economic dispatch based on offers in energy market or reliability needs
event_triggers.other_conditions: ADCRs participate in FCM. DRRs can participate in energy and reserve markets.

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: Forward Capacity Auction held annually, 3 years before delivery
nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Competitive auction for capacity supply obligations (CSO). Resources bid offers and compete with traditional generation.

enrollment_period.notes: Must complete qualification process before auction participation

program_evolution.change_description: FCA 18 held Feb 5, 2024 for delivery period June 2027-May 2028. DR and aggregated DER represented 8% (2,614 MW) of capacity obligations.

programs.historical_events_notes: Market-based dispatch, not traditional event-based DR. Dispatch occurs based on economic offers and system reliability needs.

integration_metadata.notes: Wholesale capacity market with 3-year forward commitment. DR can compete equally with generation. Requires qualification process. Complex but potentially lucrative for large resources.

programs.description: PJM wholesale energy market demand response program allowing resources to bid load reductions and be compensated at locational marginal prices.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Wholesale energy market - commercial/industrial only. No specific size thresholds.

eligibility.notes: Customer classes: Wholesale energy market - commercial/industrial only

performance_rate.notes: Paid locational marginal price (LMP) when dispatched. Historic maximum strike price up to $1,849/MWh.

call_windows.notes: Economic dispatch whenever LMP-based bid clears

event_triggers.trigger_description: Economic dispatch based on LMP thresholds
event_triggers.primary_trigger: Load-weighted LMP exceeds participant's bid price
event_triggers.other_conditions: Called whenever economic and competitive with generation

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Participants bid price threshold for dispatch. Called when market LMP exceeds bid price.

program_history.notes: 2024 capacity market revenue decreased 24.1% to $116.6M (from $153.7M in 2023). 2024/2025 delivery year capacity cleared at $28.92/MW-day in most zones.

programs.historical_events_notes: Market-based dispatch, not traditional event DR. Dispatched whenever LMP exceeds participant's bid threshold.

data_sources.source_name: 2024 State of the Market Report for PJM Section 6

integration_metadata.notes: Pure economic dispatch based on LMP. Highly suitable for battery arbitrage optimization. Requires monitoring real-time LMP and bidding strategy.

programs.program_name: Con Edison Commercial System Relief Program (CSRP) and Distribution Load Relief Program (DLRP)
programs.description: Con Edison utility demand response programs providing capacity payments for load reduction during network emergencies. DLRP is emergency-based; CSRP helps delay infrastructure investments.

service_territories: Con Edison service territory (NYC and Westchester)

eligibility.notes: Can participate through aggregator or direct enrollment. Can stack with NYISO SCR program. Customer classes: Commercial and industrial customers only

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Commercial and industrial customers only. No specific size thresholds documented.

capacity_rate.notes: Tier 2 networks paid at higher rate than Tier 1. Both Reservation and Voluntary options available. Specific 2024 rates in Rider T section beginning Leaf 268. Contact demandresponse@coned.com for current rates.

seasons.notes: Program operates on NYISO capability periods

call_windows.notes: Called during network emergencies or to address distribution system needs

event_triggers.trigger_description: Network emergencies and distribution system stress
event_triggers.primary_trigger: DLRP: Network emergencies. CSRP: Distribution system needs to defer infrastructure investments
event_triggers.other_conditions: Utility exercises discretion based on network conditions

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Fixed payment rates by tier. Reservation option (mandatory) or Voluntary option available.

program_evolution.change_description: CSRP enrollment increased 7% from 437 MW to 466.20 MW. DLRP enrollment decreased 3% from 488 MW to 472.51 MW.

programs.historical_events_notes: Historical event data not publicly available. Contact Con Edison for program performance history.

data_sources.source_name: Con Edison Rider T Program Guidelines

integration_metadata.notes: Limited public data on payment rates and event history. Can stack with NYISO programs. Must contact utility for detailed participation terms.
